biogHist.abstract: Condingup Hostel, near Esperance, was established by the Australian Aborigines Evangelical Mission (AAEM) around 1967 to accommodate Aboriginal boys working on nearby farms. Some of these boys had been at Wongutha Mission. From January 1975, the Churches of Christ Federal Aborigines Mission Board (Inc.) (CCFAMB) ran the Condingup Hostel to provide training and support for seven young men (aged 16 to 21 years) from the Norseman Mission. Boys were taken to and picked up from their workplace during this time. Condingup closed in February 1976. It is possible that some young men went to live at the AAEM Hostel in Esperance when Condingup closed.

chronItem.event: Location - Condingup Hostel was located at Lots 50-51 in the township of Condingup, 69 kilometres from Esperance

cpfRelation.relationEntry: Australian Churches of Christ Indigenous Ministries (2009 - 2013)

descriptiveNote.p: Condingup Hostel accommodated some boys from Wongutha Mission Training Farm when they went out to work in the Esperance area.

descriptiveNote.p: State Archives Collection of Western Australia holds administrative records for Condingup Hostel.

cpfRelation.relationEntry: Department of Aboriginal Affairs [predecessors], Records, Department of Aboriginal Affairs (1886 - 2004)

descriptiveNote.p: Condingup Hostel accommodated some boys after they left Norseman Mission to gain work skills in the Esperance area.

Young men from the Australian Aboriginal Evangelical Mission Hostel and the Condingup Hostel socialised regularly in Esperance while Condingup was managed by the Churches of Churches of Christ Federal Aborigines Mission Board (Inc.), and it is possible that some Condingup residents went to live at the AAEM Hostel in Esperance when Condingup closed.
Young people from the Condingup Hostel and Fairhaven Hostel regularly socialised in Esperance, as part of the Church of Christ community in that town.

archref.abstract: 'Churches of Christ 'Fairhaven' Hostel, Esperance' is a history of the Churches of Christ's management of Fairhaven. It was written by Deslee Moyle, who has preserved many archival records relating to the Churches of Christ Federal Aborigines Mission Board (CCFAMB) and the organisation that followed it, the Australian Churches of Christ Indigenous Ministries (ACCIM). The item gives insight into life at Fairhaven and associated church activities in Esperance. The item also mentions the AAEM Hostel, Esperance; Condingup (Working Boys' Hostel); Norseman Mission, Cundeelee, and Wongutha.

resourceRelation.relationEntry: Condingup Hostel for Working Young Men, Esperance

archref.unittitle: Condingup Hostel for Working Young Men, Esperance
archref.abstract: 'Condingup Hostel for Working Young Men, Esperance' is a history of the Condingup Hostel from January 1975 to February 1976, during the Churches of Christ's management. It was written by Deslee Moyle, who has preserved many archival records relating to the Churches of Christ Federal Aborigines Mission Board (CCFAMB) and the organisation that followed it, the Australian Churches of Christ Indigenous Ministries (ACCIM). The item gives insight into why these young men were at Condingup, and what they did there. The item also mentions that the young men had come from the Norseman Mission and that they regularly socialised with the students and boarders at the Fairhaven Hostel in Esperance.
